page.title: 10Place Farm
page.content: A group went to{Place Farm}to interview{Mr and Mrs Carter}the owners. The whole farm is{700 arces altogether. The house use to be a monestry and belonged to the church. The house is built from{Tisbury and {Chilmark stone.}The kitchen used to be where the lounge is now. During the change a bread oven was broken by mistake. The{tithe barn}is the biggest in England and is approximately 125 feet long. The word tithe means tenth. Every year everyone used to give one tenth of their produce to the church and this was stored in the tithe barn. The buildings at Place Farm are Medieval In the stables there are the names of horses on the wall from olden times.
